subject: Re: [junit] Multithreaded test runner
msgSnippet: ... If they have, I ve never seen it. I ve only seen MTUnit for testing multithreaded code and the ActiveTestSuite extension for multithreaded tests. Maybe
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:

> In the most extreme case I've encountered, the full test suite takes
> couple of hours to run. However, that's almost all spent waiting for the
> network, so it would be extremely parallelizable. Has anyone done this?

If they have, I've never seen it. I've only seen MTUnit for testing
multithreaded code and the ActiveTestSuite extension for multithreaded
tests. Maybe ActiveTestSuite could help? Wrap your entire test suite in
an ActiveTestSuite and see what happens, or somesuch.

I'm no threading expert, so I can't speak any more intelligently than
that. :)

Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
